metadata.titleEn: HiWATER: Dataset of hydrometeorological observation network (No.8 runoff observation system of Gaotai  bridge on the Heihe River, 2013)
metadata.titleCn: 黑河生态水文遥感试验：水文气象观测网数据集（8号点-高台桥径流观测数据-2013）
metadata.description:
The No. 8 hydrological section is located at Gaotai Heihe River Bridge (N39° 23′22.93 ″, E 99° 49′37.29″, 1347 m a.s.l.)  in the midstream of the Heihe River Basin, Zhangye city, Gansu Province. The dataset contains observations recorded by the No.8 hydrological section from 17 June, 2012, to 31 December, 2013. The width of this section is 210 meters. The water level was measured using an SR50 ultrasonic range and the discharge was measured using cross-section reconnaissance by the StreamPro ADCP. The dataset includes the following parameters: water level (recorded every 30 minutes) and discharge. The missing and incorrect (outside the normal range) data were replaced with -6999.
For more information, please refer to Li et al. (2013) (for hydrometeorological observation network or sites information), He et al. (2016) (for data processing) in the Citation section.
metadata.descriptionCn:
该数据集包含了2012年6月17日至2013年12月31日的黑河中游径流加密观测中8号点的河流水位和流速观测数据。观测点位于甘肃省张掖市高台县黑河桥，河床为泥沙，断面稳定。观测点的经纬度是N39°23'22.93"，N 99°49'37.29"，海拔1347米，河道宽度210米。水位观测采用SR50超声测距仪，采集频率30分钟。数据说明包括以下两部分：
水位的观测频率30分钟，单位（cm）；数据涵盖时间段2012年6月17日-2013年12月31日；流量观测，单位（m3）；按照不同水位监测流量，获取水位流量曲线，依托水位过程观测获得径流量变化过程。8号点-高台桥断面受到湿地公园人为排蓄水扰动，水位流量曲线有待进一步观测。缺值数据统一采用字符串-6999表示。
水文气象网或站点信息请参考Li et al. (2013)，观测数据处理请参考He et al.(2016)。

background: Upscaling of eco-hydrological processes on a heterogeneous surface is a grand challenge. Progress in this field is hindered by the poor availability of multiscale observations. HiWATER is an experiment designed to address this challenge through instrumentation on hierarchically nested scales to obtain multiscale and multidisciplinary data.
challenges: Progress in this field is hindered by the poor availability of multiscale observations.
methods: Several intensive observation periods (IOPs) and continuous hydrometeorological observations were carried out during HiWATER. Only data collected during the IOP in 2012 are presented in this paper. Instruments for the oasis-desert system were arranged in hierarchically nested scales to capture multi-scale eco-hydrological processes. We established a sparse network to investigate the oasis-desert interaction. One superstation was constructed within the oasis, and four EC towers and four two-layer automatic meteorological stations (AMSs) were installed in different landscapes surrounding the oasis, including sandy desert, desert pavement, desert steppe, and wetland. Intensive observations were implemented at the irrigation district scale. A total of 12 airborne remote sensing missions were conducted to cover the FEA using LiDAR, an imaging spectrometer, a multi-angle thermal imager, and an L-band microwave radiometer.
dataset: We introduce a multiscale dataset obtained from Heihe Watershed Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER) in an oasis-desert area in 2012. The HiWATER observation system consists of a flux observation matrix of eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, and automatic meteorological stations; an eco-hydrological sensor network of soil moisture and leaf area index; hyper-resolution airborne remote sensing using LiDAR, imaging spectrometer, multi-angle thermal imager, and L-band microwave radiometer; and synchronical ground measurements of vegetation dynamics and photosynthesis processes. All observational data were carefully quality controlled throughout sensor calibration, data collection, data processing, and datasets generation. The data are freely available at figshare and the Cold and Arid Regions Science Data Centre.
backgroundCn: 生态水文过程在异质表面上的放大是一个重大挑战。该领域的进展受到多尺度观测稀缺的制约。HiWATER实验旨在通过在分层嵌套尺度上进行仪器布置，以获取多尺度和多学科的数据，从而应对这一挑战。
challengesCn: 该领域的进展受到多尺度观测稀缺的阻碍。
methodsCn: 在HiWATER期间进行了几次强烈观测期（IOPs）和连续的水文气象观测。本文仅展示了2012年IOP期间收集的数据。为了捕捉多尺度生态水文过程，绿洲-沙漠系统的仪器按照层次嵌套的尺度进行布置。我们建立了一个稀疏网络，以研究绿洲-沙漠的相互作用。在绿洲内建造了一个超级站，并在绿洲周围不同的景观中安装了四个涡度协方差（EC）塔和四个两层自动气象站（AMS），这些景观包括沙漠、沙漠铺装、沙漠草原和湿地。在灌溉区尺度上实施了强烈观测。共进行了12次空中遥感任务，使用了激光雷达、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计覆盖了FEA。
datasetCn: 我们介绍了一个多尺度数据集，该数据集来自2012年在绿洲-沙漠地区进行的黑河流域联合遥测实验研究（HiWATER）。HiWATER观测系统由涡度协方差塔、大孔径闪烁仪和自动气象站组成的通量观测矩阵；土壤湿度和叶面积指数的生态水文传感器网络；使用激光雷达、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计的超高分辨率航空遥感；以及同步的植被动态和光合作用过程的地面测量。所有观测数据在传感器校准、数据收集、数据处理和数据集生成过程中都经过了严格的质量控制。这些数据可在figshare和寒区与干旱区科学数据中心免费获取。

background: Arid and semiarid regions represent approximately 30 % of the global terrestrial surface area (Dregne, 1991; Scanlon et al., 2006), and dryland expansion occurs under climate change, especially in developing countries (Huang et al., 2016). An oasis is a unique ecological landscape in arid and semi-arid areas that is not only the core of regions’ ecological environment but also the foundation of their economic development, especially in western China, which has been an important part of the “Silk Road” since ancient times. Oases comprising less than 10 % of the total area of arid regions support more than 90 % of the population in these regions of China (Chu et al., 2005; Li et al., 2016; Zhou et al., 2022). The oasis–desert system plays a crucial role in maintaining a stable ecological environment and agricultural productivity (Zhang and Zhao, 2015). Extensive studies have investigated energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas based on field and remote-sensing observations (Taha et al., 1991; Potchter et al., 2008; Xue et al., 2019; Wang et al., 2019; Zhou et al., 2022) and numerical simulations (Chu et al., 2005; Meng et al., 2009; Georgescu et al., 2011; Liu et al., 2020). In addition, oasis–desert areas located in semiarid regions have been found to be carbon sinks by previous researchers (Tagesson et al., 2016; Wang et al., 2019); thus, they can significantly affect the carbon balance of arid regions and play an increasingly important role within the global carbon cycle.
research objective: Therefore, it is critical to maintain the balance between oasis and desert systems in order to achieve the goal of sustainable oasis development. Understanding the basic characteristics of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems is important to achieve the goals of carbon peaking and carbon neutrality in the oasis–desert area and support the ecological security and sustainable development of the oasis. A quantitative understanding of the energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas is crucial to recognize the oasis–desert interactions and is significant to protect the ecological stability and socioeconomic development of oases; moreover, long-term observations are indispensable.
challenges: Inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas are facing the crisis of ecological environment degradation, such as the drying up of rivers and lakes, the degradation of natural vegetation, the intensification of land desertification, and the frequent occurrence of dust storms, especially in many inland river basins westward along the Silk Road, such as the Tarim River basin (Zhao et al., 2013), the Aral Sea basin (Stanev et al., 2004; Crétaux et al., 2009), and the Lake Urmia basin (Stone, 2015).
methods: In this study, we present a suite of observational datasets from artificial and natural oasis–desert systems that consist of long-term energy, water vapor, carbon and methane fluxes as well as auxiliary data involving hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters from 2012 to 2021. Half-hourly turbulent flux data were acquired by an eddy covariance system and scintillometer. The hydrometeorological data (including radiation, soil heat flux, and soil temperature profiles; gradients of air temperature and humidity and of wind speed and direction; and air pressure, precipitation, and soil moisture profiles) were observed from automatic weather stations with a 10 min average period as well as the groundwater table data. Moreover, vegetation and soil parameters were also supplemented in the datasets. The data processing and quality control procedure can be divided into data collection, data processing, and data archiving and sharing.
dataset: The study area comprises the middle and lower reaches of the HRB, located in the arid regions of western China, that receive water from the typical cryosphere of the upper reaches. A total of 11 land surface flux and meteorological stations have been established in these regions since 2012 – 2 superstations and 9 ordinary stations. The dataset of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange observations in oasis–desert areas reported in this study (including energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes; hydrometeorological data; and vegetation and soil parameters) is freely available from the National Tibetan Plateau Data Center.
backgroundCn: 干旱和半干旱地区大约占全球陆地表面积的30%（Dregne, 1991；Scanlon et al., 2006），在气候变化的影响下，干旱地区的扩展尤其发生在发展中国家（Huang et al., 2016）。绿洲是干旱和半干旱地区独特的生态景观，不仅是这些地区生态环境的核心，也是其经济发展的基础，尤其是在中国西部，自古以来就一直是“丝绸之路”的重要组成部分。绿洲占干旱地区总面积的不到10%，却支持了中国这些地区90%以上的人口（Chu et al., 2005；Li et al., 2016；Zhou et al., 2022）。绿洲-沙漠系统在维持稳定的生态环境和农业生产力方面发挥着至关重要的作用（Zhang and Zhao, 2015）。大量研究基于实地和遥感观测（Taha et al., 1991；Potchter et al., 2008；Xue et al., 2019；Wang et al., 2019；Zhou et al., 2022）以及数值模拟（Chu et al., 2005；Meng et al., 2009；Georgescu et al., 2011；Liu et al., 2020）对绿洲-沙漠地区的能量、水汽和碳交换进行了广泛研究。此外，位于半干旱地区的绿洲-沙漠地区已被先前研究者发现为碳汇（Tagesson et al., 2016；Wang et al., 2019）；因此，它们可以显著影响干旱地区的碳平衡，并在全球碳循环中发挥越来越重要的作用。
research objectiveCn: 因此，维持绿洲与沙漠系统之间的平衡对于实现可持续绿洲发展的目标至关重要。了解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水汽和碳交换的基本特征，对于实现绿洲-沙漠地区的碳达峰和碳中和目标，以及支持绿洲的生态安全和可持续发展具有重要意义。对绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换的定量理解对于认识绿洲-沙漠之间的相互作用至关重要，并对保护绿洲的生态稳定性和社会经济发展具有重要意义；此外，长期观测是不可或缺的。
challengesCn: 内陆河流流域在干旱和半干旱地区面临生态环境退化的危机，例如河流和湖泊干涸、自然植被退化、土地沙漠化加剧以及沙尘暴频发，尤其是在丝绸之路沿线的许多内陆河流流域，如塔里木河流域（赵等，2013）、咸海流域（Stanev等，2004；Crétaux等，2009）和乌尔米湖流域（Stone，2015）。
methodsCn: 在本研究中，我们呈现了一套来自人工和自然绿洲-沙漠系统的观测数据集，这些数据集包含了2012年至2021年的长期能量、水蒸气、碳和甲烷通量，以及涉及水文气象、植被和土壤参数的辅助数据。半小时的湍流通量数据是通过涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪获取的。水文气象数据（包括辐射、土壤热通量和土壤温度剖面；空气温度和湿度的梯度，风速和风向的梯度；以及气压、降水和土壤湿度剖面）是通过自动气象站以10分钟的平均周期观测的，同时还包括地下水位数据。此外，数据集中还补充了植被和土壤参数。数据处理和质量控制程序可以分为数据收集、数据处理和数据归档与共享。
datasetCn: 研究区域包括位于中国西部干旱地区的HRB中下游，水源来自上游典型的冰冻圈。自2012年以来，在这些地区建立了11个地表通量和气象站，包括2个超级站和9个普通站。本研究报告的绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换观测数据集（包括能量、水汽和碳通量；水文气象数据；以及植被和土壤参数）可从国家西藏高原数据中心免费获取。

Concept Completion.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中，用于捕捉能量、水蒸气和碳交换的数据收集方法有哪些？
Concept Completion.AnswerEn: eddy covariance system, scintillometer, automatic weather stations
Concept Completion.AnswerCn: 涡度相关系统、闪烁仪、自动气象站

Concept Completion.QuestionEn: When were the intensive observation periods for eco-hydrological processes in the Heihe Watershed conducted?
Concept Completion.QuestionCn: 在黑河流域进行生态水文过程的强化观测期是什么时候？

Example.QuestionEn: Can you provide an example of a data collection method used to capture eco-hydrological processes in an oasis-desert system?
Example.QuestionCn: 您能否提供一个用于捕捉绿洲-沙漠系统中生态水文过程的数据收集方法的例子？
Example.AnswerEn: One example of a data collection method is the use of hierarchically nested instrumentation scales, such as eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, and automatic meteorological stations, to capture multiscale eco-hydrological processes in an oasis-desert system.
Example.AnswerCn: 一种数据收集方法是使用分层嵌套的仪器量表，例如涡度协方差塔、大孔径闪烁仪和自动气象站，以捕捉绿洲-沙漠系统中的多尺度生态水文过程。

Example.QuestionEn: What is an example of a challenge faced in collecting multiscale observations for eco-hydrological processes?
Example.QuestionCn: 收集生态水文过程的多尺度观测时面临的一个挑战是什么？
Example.AnswerEn: A challenge faced in collecting multiscale observations for eco-hydrological processes is the poor availability of such data, which hinders progress in understanding these processes.
Example.AnswerCn: 在收集生态水文过程的多尺度观测数据时面临的一个挑战是数据的可用性较差，这阻碍了对这些过程的理解进展。

Example.QuestionEn: Could you provide an example of a dataset that includes both airborne remote sensing and ground-based measurements for studying oasis-desert interactions?
Example.QuestionCn: 您能否提供一个包含航空遥感和地面测量的示例数据集，用于研究绿洲与沙漠之间相互作用？
Example.AnswerEn: An example of such a dataset includes multiscale observations from Heihe Watershed Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER), which combines hyper-resolution airborne remote sensing using LiDAR, imaging spectrometer, multi-angle thermal imager, and L-band microwave radiometer, with synchronical ground measurements of vegetation dynamics and photosynthesis processes.
Example.AnswerCn: 这样的数据集的一个例子包括来自黑河流域联合遥感实验研究（HiWATER）的多尺度观测，该研究结合了超高分辨率的航空遥感技术，包括激光雷达、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计，以及同步的地面植被动态和光合作用过程的测量。

Quantification.QuestionEn: What is the frequency of water level observations in a dataset related to river monitoring?
Quantification.QuestionCn: 与河流监测相关的数据集中水位观测的频率是多少？

Quantification.QuestionEn: How many airborne remote sensing missions were conducted during a specific observation period in the HiWATER experiment?
Quantification.QuestionCn: 在HiWATER实验的特定观测期间，进行了多少次空中遥感任务？

Quantification.QuestionEn: How many land surface flux and meteorological stations have been established in arid regions of western China since 2012 for a particular study?
Quantification.QuestionCn: 自2012年以来，在中国西部的干旱地区为某项特定研究建立了多少个地表通量和气象站？

Definition.QuestionEn: What is meant by 'oasis–desert interaction' in the context of eco-hydrological research?
Definition.QuestionCn: 在生态水文学研究的背景下，“绿洲–沙漠互动”指的是绿洲地区与周围沙漠环境之间的相互作用。这种互动涉及水分、植被、土壤和气候等因素的相互影响，影响着生态系统的健康和可持续性。
Definition.AnswerEn: In eco-hydrological research, 'oasis–desert interaction' refers to the study of exchanges and dynamics between oasis and desert systems, including energy, water vapor, and carbon interactions. This interaction is crucial for maintaining ecological balance and supporting sustainable development in arid and semi-arid areas, particularly by observing the balance and dynamics between these contrasting ecosystems.
Definition.AnswerCn: 在生态水文研究中，“绿洲-沙漠相互作用”指的是对绿洲和沙漠系统之间的交换和动态的研究，包括能量、水蒸气和碳的相互作用。这种相互作用对于维持生态平衡和支持干旱及半干旱地区的可持续发展至关重要，特别是通过观察这些对比生态系统之间的平衡和动态。

Comparison.QuestionEn: How does the data collection method using eddy covariance towers compare to that of automatic meteorological stations in terms of capturing energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis-desert areas?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 使用涡度协方差塔的数据收集方法与自动气象站在捕捉绿洲-沙漠地区的能量、水蒸气和碳交换方面相比如何？
Comparison.AnswerEn: Eddy covariance towers are used to acquire half-hourly turbulent flux data, which provide detailed information on energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange. In contrast, automatic meteorological stations collect hydrometeorological data, including radiation, soil heat flux, and soil temperature profiles, with a 10-minute average period. Both methods offer complementary insights, but eddy covariance towers focus more on flux exchanges, while meteorological stations provide broader environmental context.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 涡度协方差塔用于获取半小时的湍流通量数据，这些数据提供了关于能量、水蒸气和碳交换的详细信息。相比之下，自动气象站收集水文气象数据，包括辐射、土壤热通量和土壤温度剖面，平均周期为10分钟。这两种方法提供了互补的见解，但涡度协方差塔更侧重于通量交换，而气象站则提供更广泛的环境背景。

Comparison.QuestionEn: What are the differences in data quality control procedures between multiscale datasets obtained from Heihe Watershed Allied Telemetry Experimental Research and long-term oasis-desert system datasets?
Comparison.QuestionCn: Heihe Watershed Allied Telemetry Experimental Research获得的多尺度数据集与长期绿洲-沙漠系统数据集之间的数据质量控制程序有什么区别？
Comparison.AnswerEn: The multiscale datasets from Heihe Watershed Allied Telemetry Experimental Research were carefully quality controlled throughout sensor calibration, data collection, data processing, and dataset generation. In contrast, the long-term oasis-desert system datasets emphasize a procedure divided into data collection, processing, and archiving and sharing, with a focus on ensuring consistent quality over an extended period from 2012 to 2021.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 来自黑河流域联合遥测实验研究的多尺度数据集在传感器校准、数据收集、数据处理和数据集生成的整个过程中进行了仔细的质量控制。相比之下，长期绿洲-沙漠系统数据集强调了一个分为数据收集、处理和归档共享的程序，重点确保从2012年到2021年期间的一致质量。

Comparison.QuestionEn: How do the challenges of obtaining multiscale observations in oasis-desert systems compare to those faced in inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠系统中获取多尺度观测的挑战与在干旱和半干旱地区的内陆河流流域面临的挑战相比如何？
Comparison.AnswerEn: In oasis-desert systems, the primary challenge is the poor availability of multiscale observations needed to understand energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange processes. In contrast, inland river basins face ecological degradation challenges, such as drying rivers and vegetation degradation, which complicate the collection of hydrological and ecological data needed to address these environmental issues.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 在绿洲-沙漠系统中，主要挑战是缺乏多尺度观测数据，这些数据对于理解能量、水蒸气和碳交换过程至关重要。相比之下，内陆河流流域面临生态退化的挑战，如河流干涸和植被退化，这使得收集解决这些环境问题所需的水文和生态数据变得复杂。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: How do the observed patterns of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange data inform the sustainability strategies for oasis-desert ecosystems?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 观察到的能量、水蒸气和碳交换数据如何为绿洲-沙漠生态系统的可持续发展战略提供信息？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: The observed patterns provide critical insights into the balance between oasis and desert systems, which is essential for sustainable development. By quantifying energy, water vapor, and carbon exchanges, researchers can better understand the oasis-desert interactions, crucial for maintaining ecological stability and supporting socioeconomic development. This understanding is vital for achieving goals like carbon neutrality and ecological security in these regions.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 观察到的模式为绿洲与沙漠系统之间的平衡提供了关键见解，这对可持续发展至关重要。通过量化能量、水汽和碳的交换，研究人员可以更好地理解绿洲与沙漠的相互作用，这对维持生态稳定和支持社会经济发展至关重要。这种理解对于实现碳中和和生态安全等目标在这些地区是至关重要的。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What factors contribute to the need for hierarchically nested scales in capturing eco-hydrological processes in oasis-desert systems?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在捕捉绿洲-沙漠系统中的生态水文过程时，哪些因素促使需要层次嵌套的尺度？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Progress in understanding eco-hydrological processes is hindered by the poor availability of multiscale observations, necessitating the use of hierarchically nested scales to capture these processes effectively.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 对生态水文过程的理解进展受到多尺度观测稀缺的阻碍，因此需要使用分层嵌套的尺度来有效捕捉这些过程。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: Why is it critical to maintain a balance between oasis and desert systems to achieve sustainable development in arid regions?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在干旱地区，实现可持续发展至关重要的是保持绿洲和沙漠系统之间的平衡。
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Maintaining the balance between oasis and desert systems is crucial to achieve sustainable development because oases are essential for ecological stability and economic development, supporting more than 90% of the population in arid regions despite comprising less than 10% of the area.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 维持绿洲与沙漠系统之间的平衡对实现可持续发展至关重要，因为绿洲对生态稳定和经济发展至关重要，尽管其面积不到10%，却支持了干旱地区90%以上的人口。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What causes the challenge of ecological environment degradation in inland river basins of arid and semiarid areas?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 导致干旱和半干旱地区内陆河流流域生态环境退化的挑战是什么？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Inland river basins face degradation due to factors such as the drying up of rivers and lakes, degradation of natural vegetation, intensification of land desertification, and frequent dust storms, especially in regions like the Tarim River basin and the Aral Sea basin.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 内陆河流流域面临退化，原因包括河流和湖泊干涸、自然植被退化、土地沙漠化加剧以及频繁的沙尘暴，特别是在塔里木河流域和咸海流域等地区。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: How might the implementation of hierarchical instrumentation networks affect the quality and availability of data in arid and semi-arid regions?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 分层仪器网络的实施可能会如何影响干旱和半干旱地区数据的质量和可用性？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: The implementation of hierarchical instrumentation networks could enhance the quality and availability of data by facilitating continuous and intensive observations across multiple scales. This can improve the understanding of hydrometeorological processes and provide reliable datasets for assessing ecological stability and supporting sustainable development in oasis-desert areas.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 分层仪器网络的实施可以通过在多个尺度上促进持续和密集的观测，从而提高数据的质量和可用性。这可以改善对水文气象过程的理解，并提供可靠的数据集，以评估生态稳定性并支持绿洲-沙漠地区的可持续发展。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What consequences might arise from the lack of long-term multiscale observations in understanding oasis-desert ecosystems?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 缺乏长期多尺度观测可能会导致在理解绿洲-沙漠生态系统方面出现以下后果：
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: The absence of long-term multiscale observations may hinder the quantitative understanding of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis-desert ecosystems, which is crucial for recognizing interactions and maintaining ecological balance. This could negatively impact efforts towards ecological security and sustainable development, as well as strategies for carbon neutrality and peaking.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 长期多尺度观测的缺乏可能会妨碍对绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水汽和碳交换的定量理解，这对于认识相互作用和维持生态平衡至关重要。这可能会对生态安全和可持续发展努力产生负面影响，以及对碳中和和碳达峰策略的影响。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What is the aim of employing a multiscale observation system in the collection of eco-hydrological data in arid regions?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在干旱地区收集生态水文数据时，采用多尺度观测系统的目的是为了更好地理解和监测生态系统与水文过程之间的相互作用。
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The aim of employing a multiscale observation system is to address the challenge of upscaling eco-hydrological processes on heterogeneous surfaces by obtaining multiscale and multidisciplinary data. This approach is intended to provide comprehensive insights into oasis-desert interactions and support sustainable development in arid regions.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 采用多尺度观测系统的目的是通过获取多尺度和多学科的数据，解决在异质表面上进行生态水文过程上升尺度的挑战。该方法旨在提供对绿洲-沙漠相互作用的全面洞察，并支持干旱地区的可持续发展。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: Why is there a focus on understanding energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis-desert ecosystems?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 为什么要关注绿洲-沙漠生态系统中的能量、水蒸气和碳交换的理解？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: Understanding energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis-desert ecosystems is crucial to achieve the goals of carbon peaking and carbon neutrality, maintain ecological stability, and support the socioeconomic development of oases. This understanding is significant for recognizing oasis-desert interactions and protecting the ecological environment.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 理解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中的能量、水汽和碳交换，对于实现碳达峰和碳中和目标、维持生态稳定以及支持绿洲的社会经济发展至关重要。这种理解对于认识绿洲-沙漠之间的相互作用和保护生态环境具有重要意义。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: How are multiscale observations integrated into datasets for eco-hydrological research in oasis-desert systems?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 多尺度观测如何被整合到绿洲-沙漠系统的生态水文研究数据集中？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Multiscale observations are integrated into datasets by using a combination of a flux observation matrix including eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, and automatic meteorological stations; an eco-hydrological sensor network; and hyper-resolution airborne remote sensing. These instruments are organized in hierarchically nested scales to capture multi-scale eco-hydrological processes. Additionally, synchronical ground measurements of vegetation dynamics and photosynthesis processes are included to enrich the dataset.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 多尺度观测通过结合通量观测矩阵（包括涡度协方差塔、大孔径闪烁仪和自动气象站）、生态水文传感器网络以及超高分辨率航空遥感数据集成到一起。这些仪器按照层次嵌套的尺度组织，以捕捉多尺度生态水文过程。此外，还包括同步的地面测量数据，以丰富植被动态和光合作用过程的数据集。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What instrumentation and observation systems enable the collection of multiscale eco-hydrological data in heterogeneous surfaces?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些仪器和观测系统能够在异质表面上收集多尺度生态水文数据？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The HiWATER experiment utilizes a flux observation matrix consisting of eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, and automatic meteorological stations, along with an eco-hydrological sensor network and hyper-resolution airborne remote sensing technologies like LiDAR and imaging spectrometers.
Enablement.AnswerCn: HiWATER实验利用一个通量观测矩阵，包括涡度协方差塔、大孔径闪烁仪和自动气象站，以及生态水文传感器网络和超高分辨率的航空遥感技术，如激光雷达和成像光谱仪。

Enablement.QuestionEn: How do advancements in airborne remote sensing technologies facilitate the collection of detailed observational data in oasis-desert systems?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 空气遥感技术的进步如何促进在绿洲-沙漠系统中收集详细观测数据？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Advancements such as LiDAR, imaging spectrometers, multi-angle thermal imagers, and L-band microwave radiometers allow for comprehensive airborne remote sensing missions, enabling detailed data collection over complex landscapes like oasis-desert systems.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 诸如LiDAR、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计等先进技术，使得全面的航空遥感任务成为可能，从而能够在复杂的景观如绿洲-沙漠系统上进行详细的数据收集。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What strategies are implemented to ensure quality control and data accuracy in long-term eco-hydrological observations?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 为了确保长期生态水文观测中的质量控制和数据准确性，实施了哪些策略？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Data quality control is ensured through careful sensor calibration, robust data collection processes, and meticulous data processing and archiving, as demonstrated in the collection of hydrometeorological and flux data from automatic weather stations and eddy covariance systems.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 数据质量控制通过仔细的传感器校准、稳健的数据收集过程以及细致的数据处理和归档来确保，这在自动气象站和涡度协方差系统收集水文气象和通量数据的过程中得到了体现。

Expectation.QuestionEn: What challenges might arise in ensuring the quality and consistency of multiscale eco-hydrological data collection, and how can they be addressed?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在确保多尺度生态水文数据收集的质量和一致性时，可能会出现哪些挑战，以及如何应对这些挑战？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Progress in this field is hindered by the poor availability of multiscale observations. The data are carefully quality controlled throughout sensor calibration, data collection, data processing, and datasets generation. Instruments for the oasis-desert system were arranged in hierarchically nested scales to capture multi-scale eco-hydrological processes.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 该领域的进展受到多尺度观测数据稀缺的限制。这些数据在传感器校准、数据收集、数据处理和数据集生成的过程中经过了严格的质量控制。用于绿洲-沙漠系统的仪器按照层次嵌套的尺度进行安排，以捕捉多尺度生态水文过程。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why is it important to maintain a balance between oasis and desert systems when collecting data on energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在收集关于能量、水蒸气和碳交换的数据时，保持绿洲和沙漠系统之间的平衡是重要的。
Expectation.AnswerEn: Understanding the basic characteristics of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems is important to achieve the goals of carbon peaking and carbon neutrality in the oasis–desert area and support the ecological security and sustainable development of the oasis. A quantitative understanding is crucial to recognize the oasis–desert interactions and is significant to protect the ecological stability and socioeconomic development of oases.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 了解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水汽和碳交换的基本特征，对于实现绿洲-沙漠地区的碳达峰和碳中和目标，以及支持绿洲的生态安全和可持续发展至关重要。定量理解对于认识绿洲-沙漠之间的相互作用至关重要，并对保护生态稳定性和绿洲的社会经济发展具有重要意义。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might there be difficulties in obtaining comprehensive datasets for inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas, and what strategies could be employed to overcome these?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在干旱和半干旱地区，获取内陆河流流域的综合数据集可能会面临困难，原因包括：数据收集的基础设施不足、气候变化导致的水文变化、缺乏长期监测站点、地方政府和社区对数据共享的抵触等。为了克服这些困难，可以采取以下策略：加强与地方政府和社区的合作，建立数据共享机制；利用遥感技术和地理信息系统（GIS）进行数据收集和分析；开展公众参与的监测项目，鼓励当地居民参与数据收集；以及寻求国际合作，借助外部资源和技术支持。
Expectation.AnswerEn: Inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas are facing the crisis of ecological environment degradation, such as the drying up of rivers and lakes, the degradation of natural vegetation, the intensification of land desertification, and the frequent occurrence of dust storms. Strategies to overcome these challenges include establishing a suite of observational datasets from artificial and natural oasis–desert systems that consist of long-term energy, water vapor, carbon and methane fluxes as well as auxiliary data involving hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 内陆河流流域在干旱和半干旱地区面临生态环境退化的危机，例如河流和湖泊干涸、自然植被退化、土地沙漠化加剧以及沙尘暴频繁发生。克服这些挑战的策略包括建立一套来自人工和自然绿洲–沙漠系统的观测数据集，这些数据集包括长期的能量、水汽、碳和甲烷通量，以及涉及水文气象、植被和土壤参数的辅助数据。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: What are your thoughts on the challenges faced in maintaining the balance between oasis and desert systems, and how could data collection be enhanced to support sustainable development?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 您对维持绿洲与沙漠系统之间平衡所面临的挑战有何看法？如何增强数据收集以支持可持续发展？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: Maintaining the balance between oasis and desert systems is crucial, particularly in the face of ecological degradation. Challenges include river and lake drying, vegetation degradation, and desertification. Enhanced data collection could involve long-term monitoring of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchanges using advanced remote sensing technologies and increased ground-based observations to provide more accurate and timely data to inform sustainable development practices.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 维持绿洲和沙漠系统之间的平衡至关重要，特别是在生态退化的情况下。面临的挑战包括河流和湖泊干涸、植被退化和沙漠化。增强数据收集可以通过使用先进的遥感技术进行能源、水汽和碳交换的长期监测，以及增加地面观测，以提供更准确和及时的数据，从而为可持续发展实践提供信息。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I don't understand the challenges associated with acquiring multiscale observations in heterogeneous surfaces.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不理解在异质表面获取多尺度观测所面临的挑战。
Assertion.AnswerEn: One of the significant challenges is the poor availability of multiscale observations, which hampers progress in understanding eco-hydrological processes across heterogeneous surfaces. To address this, hierarchically nested scales and intensive observation periods are employed to obtain comprehensive data.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 一个重要的挑战是多尺度观测的稀缺，这妨碍了对异质表面生态水文过程的理解。为了解决这个问题，采用了分层嵌套尺度和密集观测期，以获取全面的数据。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I can't make sense of how datasets from oasis-desert areas are processed and quality-controlled before being made available.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我无法理解来自绿洲-沙漠地区的数据集是如何处理和质量控制的，然后才被提供出来。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Datasets from oasis-desert areas undergo a rigorous procedure that includes sensor calibration, data collection, data processing, and quality control measures. This ensures high-quality data that are freely available, such as those from the HiWATER project, which are accessible through platforms like figshare and the Cold and Arid Regions Science Data Centre.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 来自绿洲-沙漠地区的数据集经过严格的程序，包括传感器校准、数据收集、数据处理和质量控制措施。这确保了高质量的数据，这些数据是免费的，例如来自HiWATER项目的数据，可以通过figshare和寒冷与干旱地区科学数据中心等平台获取。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please analyze the potential challenges in maintaining long-term data quality and consistency for datasets capturing energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis-desert areas.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请分析在捕捉绿洲-沙漠地区的能量、水汽和碳交换数据集时，维护长期数据质量和一致性可能面临的挑战。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Challenges in maintaining long-term data quality and consistency include ecological environment degradation such as land desertification, drying rivers, and vegetation degradation. Consistent data quality control must be implemented through sensor calibration, data processing, and dataset generation and sharing. Long-term observations are crucial for recognizing oasis-desert interactions and supporting ecological stability.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 维护长期数据质量和一致性面临的挑战包括生态环境退化，如土地沙漠化、河流干涸和植被退化。必须通过传感器校准、数据处理以及数据集生成和共享来实施一致的数据质量控制。长期观察对于识别绿洲与沙漠的相互作用以及支持生态稳定至关重要。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please conduct a search for potential datasets that can be used to study hydrometeorological processes in arid regions, focusing on integrating eco-hydrological and vegetation dynamics data.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请搜索潜在的数据集，以研究干旱地区的水文气象过程，重点整合生态水文学和植被动态数据。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Potential datasets include those derived from the Heihe Watershed Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER) which encompass a flux observation matrix, eco-hydrological sensor networks, and hyper-resolution airborne remote sensing. These datasets provide information on soil moisture, leaf area index, and vegetation dynamics. Additionally, datasets from the National Tibetan Plateau Data Center offer long-term energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange data, supplemented with vegetation and soil parameters.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 潜在的数据集包括来自黑河流域联合遥测实验研究（HiWATER）的数据集，这些数据集涵盖了通量观测矩阵、生态水文传感器网络和超高分辨率航空遥感。这些数据集提供了土壤湿度、叶面积指数和植被动态的信息。此外，来自国家西藏高原数据中心的数据集提供了长期的能量、水蒸气和碳交换数据，并补充了植被和土壤参数。
